metadata.title: CVE-2021-38493 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 91 andFirefox ESR 78.13. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <78.14, Thunderbird < 78.14, and Firefox < 92.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.14.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
